intro: Uragoga peduncularis var. guineensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a low, bushy mound. Its leaves are usually dark green and slightly hairy, while its flowers bloom on short, sturdy stalks. It is well-suited for indoor cultivation due to its preference for bright, indirect light and consistent moisture.
